skill.name: astropy
skill.description: Comprehensive Python library for astronomy and astrophysics. This skill should be used when working with astronomical data including celestial coordinates, physical units, FITS files, cosmological calculations, time systems, tables, world coordinate systems (WCS), and astronomical data analysis. Use when tasks involve coordinate transformations, unit conversions, FITS file manipulation, cosmological distance calculations, time scale conversions, or astronomical data processing.
skill.summary: Comprehensive Python library for astronomy and astrophysics. This skill should be used when working ...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate astronomy library documentation skill with no actual security threats. All static findings are false positives from misinterpreting Python code examples in documentation as security patterns.

content.user_title: Analyze astronomical data with Python Astropy
content.value_statement: Astronomers need specialized tools to handle celestial coordinates, FITS files, and cosmological calculations. This skill provides comprehensive Astropy library documentation and examples for professional astronomy research.
actual_capabilities: Transform coordinates between ICRS, Galactic, FK5, and AltAz systems
Convert physical units with automatic dimensional analysis
Read and manipulate FITS astronomical image files
Calculate cosmological distances and times using standard models
Handle precise time scales including UTC, TAI, TT, and TDB
Perform table operations on astronomical catalogs
limitations: Requires Python environment with Astropy installed
Focused on astronomy-specific data formats and calculations
Documentation-heavy with code examples rather than executable tools
Specialized for professional astronomy research workflows

use_cases.title: Convert telescope coordinates
use_cases.description: Transform celestial coordinates between different reference frames for observational astronomy

use_cases.title: Process FITS image files
use_cases.description: Read, analyze, and manipulate astronomical images in standard FITS format

use_cases.title: Calculate cosmic distances
use_cases.description: Compute luminosity distances and lookback times for high-redshift galaxies

prompt_templates.title: Coordinate conversion
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to convert celestial coordinates from ICRS (RA=10.5h, Dec=+41d12m) to Galactic coordinates using astropy

prompt_templates.title: FITS file analysis
prompt_templates.scenario: Read and display FITS image header
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I open a FITS file and display its header information including exposure time and filter?

prompt_templates.title: Unit conversion
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert 1.5 Jy to mJy and show proper unit handling with astropy units

prompt_templates.title: Cosmological calculation
prompt_templates.prompt: Using Planck18 cosmology, calculate the luminosity distance and age of the universe for a galaxy at redshift z=0.7

output_examples.input: Convert coordinates from RA=05h23m34.5s, Dec=-69d45m22s to Galactic
output: Frame changed from ICRS to Galactic

best_practices: Always attach units to quantities for dimensional consistency
Use context managers when opening FITS files
Process coordinate arrays rather than individual points for efficiency
anti_patterns: Converting units manually instead of using astropy.units
Opening FITS files without proper error handling
Ignoring coordinate frame specifications in transformations

faq.question: What is Astropy?
faq.answer: Astropy is the core Python package for astronomy, providing tools for coordinates, units, FITS files, cosmology, and time handling

faq.question: How do I install Astropy?
faq.answer: Install with pip: 'pip install astropy' or with all dependencies: 'pip install astropy[all]'

faq.question: Can I convert between any coordinate systems?
faq.answer: Yes, astropy supports transformations between ICRS, Galactic, FK4, FK5, AltAz, and many other frames

faq.question: What file formats does astropy support?
faq.answer: Astropy supports FITS, CSV, HDF5, VOTable, and ASCII formats for tables and images

faq.question: How precise is astropy's time handling?
faq.answer: Astropy handles time scales like UTC, TAI, TT with precision better than microsecond for astronomical calculations

faq.question: Is astropy suitable for professional research?
faq.answer: Yes, astropy is the standard library used by professional astronomers and major observatories worldwide
